<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.25in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span

Holiday.</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.25in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New";
color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Please
review <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fLkXizBBFrw&feature=youtu.be">the
video link to the ICS Faculty Panel on Improving Your Grad School Application.</a>
If you were unable to attend due to a time conflict you are obliged to watch
the video, even if you currently do not plan to attend graduate school.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>If you later change your mind after you
learn more about your career, you will need to know this stuff.</span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.25in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New";
color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";
background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>REMINDER:</span><span style='font-family:
"Tahoma","sans-serif"'> ICS Faculty Panel on Improving Your Grad School
Application, Week 6, noon-1:50pm, Tuesday, 1 Nov., in DBH-6011. <a
href="grad-admissions-panel-announcement-2016.pptx">[PPT announcement here.]</a></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.25in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New";
color:black'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>Due
to schedule conflicts and the need to avoid ICS Faculty Meetings, the <u>ICS
Faculty Panel on Improving Your Grad School Application</u> <span
style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>has been rescheduled to Week 6,
noon-1:50pm, Tuesday, 1 Nov., in DBH-6011.</span><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Accordingly, presentations by Profs.
Hernando <span class=SpellE>Ombao</span> and <span class=SpellE>Yunan</span>
Chen have been advanced to Week 4 and Week 5, respectively.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Students with a schedule time conflict
are obliged to watch the video, which will be posted later in the quarter.
Please, <span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>consider carefully</span>
the US Bureau of Labor Statistics webpage on <a
href="http://www.bls.gov/careeroutlook/2016/data-on-display/education-matters.htm">Career
Outlook: Education Matters</a>.</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst style='margin-left:1.25in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l8 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New"'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>On
Wednesday, Oct. 12, Dr. Lathrop’s office hours will be 1:00-1:45pm due to
a conflicting meeting.</span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.25in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l8 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span

</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif"'>On
<span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'><a href="#_Week_2:_1">Week
2</a></span>, Wednesday, Oct. 5, <span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:
yellow'>meet in <a
href="http://www.lib.uci.edu/services/mrc/multimedia-resources-center.html">MRC-164</a></span>
at the Ayala Science Library (to right as you face library from Aldrich Park).
Julia <span class=SpellE>Gelfand</span>, the ICS librarian, will give you a
lesson in the use of the library as a research tool.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please bring your research paper by an
ICS faculty member (see Homework #1, <a href="#_Week_1:">Week 1</a>,
below).<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>If you have a course time
conflict, I will arrange a library make-up session later in the quarter.</span></p>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Place: <a
href="http://www.classrooms.uci.edu/GAC/DBH1423.html">DBH 1423</a> (building <a
href="http://www.classrooms.uci.edu/GAC/DBH.html">314</a> on the <a
href="http://communications.uci.edu/documents/pdf/UCI_14_map_campus_core.pdf">UCI
campus map</a><span class=GramE>)</span><br>
Time: Wednesday 12:00noon-12:50pm <o:p></o:p></b></p>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Two people primarily
oversee the ICS Honors Program. The <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Honors
Program Director,</i> currently Rick Lathrop, is the faculty member in charge
of the ICS Honors Program. The <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Honors
Program Counselor,</i> currently Jessica Shanahan, will help orient students
and track their progress. Feel free to ask us any questions about the Honors
Program.<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Instructor/ICS Honors
Program Director: Richard Lathrop <br>
Office hours: Wednesdays 1:00-2:00pm, or anytime by appointment, in DBH-4224<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Email: <span

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><a name="_Weekly_Faculty_Research"></a><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Weekly ICS-90 Faculty Research Lectures:<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal>Faculty research lectures: Co-located with ICS-90, Wednesday
5:00-6:00pm,<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>in <a
href="http://www.classrooms.uci.edu/GAC/BS3-1200.html">BS3 1200</a> (building <a
href="http://www.classrooms.uci.edu/GAC/BS3.html">519</a> on the <a
href="http://communications.uci.edu/documents/pdf/UCI_14_map_campus_core.pdf">UCI
campus<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>map</a>); overflow room with
streaming video in <a href="http://www.classrooms.uci.edu/GAC/HSLH100A.html">HSLH
100A</a> (building <a href="http://www.classrooms.uci.edu/GAC/HSLH.html">501</a>
on the <a
href="http://communications.uci.edu/documents/pdf/UCI_14_map_campus_core.pdf">UCI
campus map</a>). Students who already have taken ICS-90 are excused from any
research lecture by a faculty member from whom they already have heard in
ICS-90.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p> </o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>[NOTE: Some ICS-90 meetings will not involve faculty
research lectures, and can be skipped.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>See schedule as it develops (available at the bottom of <a
href="https://www.ics.uci.edu/~pattis/ICS-90/index.html">this URL</a>). The
faculty research lectures are 5-5:30pm and 5:30-6pm, which you are obliged to
attend if possible.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The time slot
6-6:20pm is reserved for advice to freshmen, which you may skip. Please attend
in the HSLH 100A room, which is for juniors and seniors (the BS3 1200 room is
for freshmen and sophomores).]</p>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=left>

</span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><a name="_Goal:"></a><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Goal:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p> </o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>ICS H197 provides an opportunity for undergraduate honors
students in the Donald Bren School of Information and Computer Sciences to
learn about the research taking place in the School and to begin to get
involved with this research. The major purpose of this course is to help you
learn what sort of research is going on, which people do what, and how to get
connected with a research project. The course will also provide a general
introduction to the scientific and technical research enterprise, including the
research literature, how to give a successful technical talk, the responsible
conduct of research, research intellectual property, and research funding (<span
class=SpellE>grantsmanship</span> and entrepreneurship). Various enrichment
activities include a library-based introduction to searching the research
literature and a faculty panel on improving your graduate school applications.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p> </o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>One of your major goals in this course is to gain an
understanding of what research is being pursued in the School and what areas
might be of interest to you for your project. This goal is <span class=GramE>crucial,</span>
since it should help you complete your next goal, selection of your faculty
advisor. Remember that the arrangement must be mutually acceptable, so there is
no guarantee that the first faculty member you talk to will say yes; it may be,
for example, that they have no suitable project in mind at the time you ask, or
already are just too busy.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p> </o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>It is not imperative that you begin your research
immediately next quarter if your schedule for graduation allows you enough
time. <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u>However, there are many
important advantages to starting early, and we encourage you to begin by next
quarter.</u></b> Starting early gives you more flexibility with regard to
finishing the rest of your degree requirements, especially if you want to
continue the research for more than two quarters. Also, students often find
that those faculty members who have supervised their honors research project
are good sources for letters of recommendation; they will be in the best
position to comment on your ability if you are well into your research project
when the letters are due (typically Dec/Jan of your senior year, with
exceptions).</p>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 align=center style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><a name="_Class_Setup:"></a><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Class Setup:<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal>This course is graded Pass/Not Pass, and the principal
formal requirement is that you attend class each week and participate in all
enrichment exercises. If you have a course time conflict, please let me know
immediately and I will make other arrangements for you.</p>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal>Additionally, to complete this course successfully you must:</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l9 level1 lfo6'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>read (at least) one research paper by an ICS
faculty member (Homework #1 below);</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l9 level1 lfo6'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>attend (at least) one outside ICS research talk
(see the <a href="http://calendar.ics.uci.edu/calendar.php?calendar=1">ICS
Calendar</a> for schedule; send me the date, speaker, and title of the talk you
attended); and</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpLast style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l9 level1 lfo6'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]><span class=GramE>attend</span> (as many as
possible of) the ICS-90 Weekly Faculty Research Lectures. Students who already
have taken ICS-90 are excused from any research lecture by a faculty member
from whom they already have heard in ICS-90.</p>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal>Some of the class exercises may involve students giving
feedback to fellow students, and your active participation is necessary for
everyone to get the most benefit from this.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p> </o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Occasional absences are inevitable given busy schedules. In
general, you are given one free absence, and others beyond that must be excused
on a case-by-case basis. Please make sure you sign the attendance sheet each
class period you attend, and please let me know whenever you cannot attend
class along with the reason.</p>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

color:red'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal>To complete the Honors Program you also must:</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l7 level1 lfo8'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>Do two quarters of independent, supervised work
(ICS-H198) with your faculty advisor; and</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpLast style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l7 level1 lfo8'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>Write and submit an Honors Report (undergraduate
thesis) on your honors work that is certified by your faculty advisor to be of
Honors quality.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p> </o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>You must keep us posted of your progress in the ICS Honors
Program by filing <a href="http://honors.ics.uci.edu/forms">these forms</a>
with the <a
href="mailto:shanahan@uci.edu?subject=ICS-H197:%20%3cplease%20edit%20Subject%3e">Honors
Program Counselor</a>:</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l5 level1 lfo10'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>File a <a
href="http://honors.ics.uci.edu/sites/honors.ics.uci.edu/files/Faculty%20contact%20report%20form.pdf">Faculty
Contact Report</a> form each quarter until you find a faculty mentor.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l5 level1 lfo10'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>File an <a
href="http://honors.ics.uci.edu/sites/honors.ics.uci.edu/files/Initial%20Plan%20for%20the%20Honors%20Project.pdf">Initial
Plan</a> form when you find a faculty mentor and agree on a research project.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l5 level1 lfo10'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>File a <a
href="http://honors.ics.uci.edu/sites/honors.ics.uci.edu/files/Final%20Project%20Form.pdf">Final
Report</a> form with your Final Honors Report (undergraduate thesis) to

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpLast style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:auto;
text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l5 level2 lfo10'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New"'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span><![endif]>Some <a
href="http://honors.ics.uci.edu/resources/sample-theses">sample theses have
been provided</a> to help you gain an understanding of what a typical thesis
looks like.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p> </o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Some substitutions are possible:</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo12'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>Students majoring in ICS or CS can count
completion of two ICS H198s as one project course.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo12'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>Students majoring in CSE can count CSE 181ABC as
one of the ICS H198s required for the Honors Program.</p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpLast style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo12'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:
Symbol'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>        
</span></span></span><![endif]>Students majoring in CSE can count <span
class=SpellE>Engr</span> H199 as one of the ICS H198s required for the Honors
Program.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p> </o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Sometimes, your advisor might ask you to take a graduate
course to substitute for the first ICS H198 quarter, which is fine.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p> </o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Sometimes, Honors Students wish to do inter-disciplinary
Honors work (ICS H198) with a UCI professor from another Department who is not
affiliated with ICS. This is encouraged. It does require special administrative
protocols, which I will navigate for you. Please let me know as early as possible
if this case applies to you.</p>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><a name="_For_Campuswide_Honors"></a><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>For <span class=SpellE>Campuswide</span> Honors
Program (CHP) Students:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal>Two types of students take this course: students in the ICS
Honors Program (ICSHP), and students in the <span class=SpellE>Campuswide</span>
Honors Program (CHP). In many ways the requirements are the same for both types
of students: you are to select a faculty advisor, do two or more quarters of
research with that advisor, and produce a report which is considered to be of
honors quality. Nevertheless, students in the <span class=SpellE>Campuswide</span>
Honors Program should discuss their plans with counselors in the CHP, in order
to make sure that they are meeting the requirements of that program.</p>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><o:p> </o:p></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='mso-tab-count:2'>                        </span><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>You learned the basics in
kindergarten:<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Don’t lie,
don’t cheat, <span class=GramE>don’t</span> steal.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:3'>                                    </span>*
Don’t lie:<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Don’t make
up false data or otherwise falsify results.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:3'>                                    </span>*
Don’t cheat:<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Don’t
misrepresent your data as something it is not or as better than it is.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:3'>                                    </span>*
Don’t steal:<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Don’t use
the words or data of others without proper credit and citation; don’t
plagiarize.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:2'>                        </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>More complicated cases may require you to
consult for advice and disclose conflicts of interest so they can be managed.<o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

</span></span></span></span><![endif]><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Email your list to Dr. Lathrop by Wed.<span
class=GramE>,9</span> Nov.<span class=MsoHyperlink><span style='color:#0033BB;
text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></b></p>

<p style='margin-left:1.25in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l6 level1 lfo20'><![if !supportLists]><span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Courier New";color:#0033BB;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
color:#0033BB'>The reason for this requirement is so that when you write your
Statement of Purpose for each school, you will be able to mention at least one
professor<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> *from that school* </b>who
interests you, and explain why. In your explanation, try to cite one or more
specific reasons why you would be a good fit. Simply saying “The CS
program there is famous.” does not make you stand out from the other
applicants.<span class=MsoHyperlink><span style='color:#0033BB;text-decoration:
none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p style='margin-left:1.25in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l6 level1 lfo20'><![if !supportLists]><span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Courier New";color:#0033BB;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
color:#0033BB'>This exercise will be more helpful if you first reflect and
introspect to focus on a single area that really interests you, instead of picking
five very different areas all of which might interest you. The reason for this
is that when you apply to grad school you will have to focus anyway, and so it
is helpful to focus before you start to pick your schools.<span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='color:#0033BB;text-decoration:none;text-underline:
none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p style='margin-left:1.25in;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l6 level1 lfo20'><![if !supportLists]><span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Courier New";color:#0033BB;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
color:#0033BB'>Some professors will do a global string search for their name
through all of the applicant's Statements of Purpose, and then preferentially
read those applications that mention their name.<span class=MsoHyperlink><span
style='color:#0033BB;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.25in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l6 level1 lfo20'><![if !supportLists]><span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Courier New";color:#0033BB;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
color:#0033BB'>Thus, if you want to improve the chances that your application
actually will be read seriously, it is helpful to you to mention names of
professors at that school who interest you.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Of course, if you mention a long list of
names it will be obvious spam, so mention no more than one to three. Also,
briefly mention something personal that attracts your interest about each,
again to indicate that it isn’t just impersonal spam.<span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='color:#0033BB;text-decoration:none;text-underline:
none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.25in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l6 level1 lfo20'><![if !supportLists]><span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Courier New";color:#0033BB;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span></span><![endif]><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:#0033BB'>Be *CAREFUL*.</span></u></b><u><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:#0033BB'> I have read email
letters and/or Statements of Purpose that state, “I greatly look forward
to doing research with Prof. Lathrop at the Univ. of Texas, Austen.” Do
not make such a careless mistake, or the reader will infer that you are prone
to careless mistakes. Please proof-read and double-check everything very
carefully, three or more times at least.<span class=MsoHyperlink><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='color:#0033BB'><o:p></o:p></span></b></span></span></u></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.25in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l6 level1 lfo20'><![if !supportLists]><span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Courier New";color:#0033BB;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
color:#0033BB'>These remarks apply mainly to Ph.D. applications.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>M.S. applications usually do not receive
as much carefully individual scrutiny as do Ph.D. applications, though the
letters may make a difference in borderline cases.<span class=MsoHyperlink><span
style='color:#0033BB;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></p>

<p style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.25in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l6 level1 lfo20'><![if !supportLists]><span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Courier New";color:#0033BB;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>o<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  
</span></span></span></span><![endif]><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'>Even if you currently do not
intend to apply to graduate school, you still must attend the Panel and do the
homework.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>If you ever change your
mind later in your career, after you know more about the field than you do now,
you will want to be well prepared.</span></u></b><span class=MsoHyperlink><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:#0033BB;text-decoration:none;
text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>
